meanings.sent1: She accidentally misstamped the envelope with the wrong date.
meanings.sent2: The post office misstamped the package, causing a delay in delivery.
meanings.sent3: The misstamped letter ended up in the wrong mailbox, much to the confusion of the recipient.
meanings.sent4: His hasty actions misstamp his reputation as a careful and detail-oriented person.
meanings.sent5: The misstamped document had to be reprinted to correct the error.

meanings.definition: A stamp that has been printed or marked incorrectly.
meanings.sent1: The collector was disappointed to find a misstamp in his rare stamp collection.
meanings.sent2: The misstamp on the letter made it a unique and valuable collector's item.
meanings.sent3: The misstamp on the envelope made it look like a rare and special edition.
meanings.sent4: The misstamp stood out among the other perfectly printed stamps in the collection.
meanings.sent5: The misstamp added a touch of quirkiness to the otherwise ordinary stamp collection.
